Yep, this week we are discussing experience points and experience 
levels.

I would like to start by commenting that if a single member has too 
much experience, the game crashes.

Not all characters get the same amount of experience for same amount 
of damage done. (see comments about crashing the game with a soldier 
who hadn't reached experience level 300)

I prefer to think when you acquire a certain amount of experience 
(forced if you exceed a max value), you should have a new option of an 
upgrade for your character to a status of "minor god" [I need to leave 
room for a higher status after this point].  At that, your mgl (minor 
god level) would become the log (base 10) of your total amount of 
experience points minus 7, rounded to the hundredths digit.  Along 
with this mgl setting, there would be some perks: access to your mgl's 
value of seconds of use of all potions and increased values for health 
and mana.  There would also be a significant disadvantage: in order to 
increase mgl value, the log (base 10) of your experience during any 
scenario minus 7 would have to be greater than 0 for that value to be 
added to your mgl value.  For those of you confused, a character with 
an mgl value of 2 would have 10 times as much experience as a 
character with an mgl value of 1 (the mgl value is about magnitude of 
experience).  

This would prevent game crashes due to too much experience and make it 
 very tough to climb up on the mgl ladder.

On the other hand, the game could simply have a limit (around 1023) on 
the level numbers for characters and generators in the game.  That 
would effectively make it impossible to acquire too much experience.
